title: Bodoni like but C is different
content:
Hi there,

I'm having a bit of trouble with this one. I thought it was Bodoni 72, but the capital C has only one serif - not the usual lower and upper serifs.  
Anyone have any idea what it could be ?  
Sorry about the low quality of the image - I have to work with a scan from the spine of the cover - so no hires images.

Thanks for your time and effort :-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417080831im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bodoni-ish_6233.jpg)

Font: 

 Times New Roman Condensed Bold 

Solved By: 

 [Renko](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417080831/http:/typophile.com/user/12000 "View user profile.")
author: Ulakanakulot

comments.content: Looks like plain [Times New Roman Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417080831/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/times-new-roman/std-condensed-bold/) to me.
It's Times New Roman, Bold Condensed. (Possibly manually condensed). Not sure which version, the Monotype version Microsoft licenced has a marginally different, flatter U.

OMG ! That's right. I guess the condensed effect got me on the wrong track.

Thanks for the replies :-)
